data.title: Smooth FM becomes Smooth Radio - Page 2
data.meta_description: Any one know if there will be any big changes to Smooth up here in Scotland will there be any new presenters or are thay keeping the same one's. Thanks
data.text:
Hi the line up at the momment is smooth radio

graham dean

mark goodier

kevin greening

martin collins

mike allen .I think we should also have a keep peter young campaign as well .Yes what is going to happen to jim colvin / russel pocket / dave brown motown sunday / cammble burnup/ ramsey lewis / dave koz / mike chadwick /david preever / also bring back john scragg /The origanal presenters on the freqeuncy of 102.2 in london must be upset by all this going on

the origanal line up was

diana luke

peter young

george read

chris phillips

hellen mayhew

tomek

paul jones

tony russel

malcom laycock

.Born 3rd march 1990 as jazz fm

(RIP) 2007 by (GMG) smooth radio

Plus there was also robbie vincent who uesd to be on and also steve collins who is on sky dig chan 0128 smooth nw 100.4 and also steve quirk. From simon astrop

0

This is clearly a pricier line up than the present lot. Question is, are they and the format going to be good enough to revive this organisations moribund fortunes in the UK's most competitive market. High salaries won't last long if it doesn't happen.

With the exception of Graham, I wonder why they haven't gone for talent with recent, proven ratings track records.

0

Borsant wrote:

This is clearly a pricier line up than the present lot. Question is, are they and the format going to be good enough to revive this organisations moribund fortunes in the UK's most competitive market. High salaries won't last long if it doesn't happen.

Well said mate

Do most people in London care who's introducing their daily fix of 'Candle in the Wind' or 'What's love got to do with it'? Are people going to change stations in droves to hear someone else announcing 'Wind beneath my Wings' in on after the break? We'll see I guess. But Magic and Heart are so many people's default radio stations and have been for so long, why should they suddenly start moving down the dial to 102.2? And how many current Smooth listeners will be alienated by the change in music policy? Will they stay or go elsewhere?

As someone said on this site, Smooth is known in London as the station 'nobody listens to'. They have a huge hurdle taking on Magic, Heart and even Capital in London, never mind Radio 2...

0
